title: Clock Divider Function Block
description:
CLK_DIV is a divider module and devides the input si￾gnal CLK into 8 levels each divided by 2, so that at the output Q0 is half
the frequency of the input CLK with 50% duty cycle available. The output
Q1 is the halved frequency of Q0 available and so on, until at Q7 the input
frequency is divided by 256. A reset input RST sets asynchronous all out￾puts to FALSE. CLK is allowed to make only one cycle to TRUE, if CLK does
not this, CLK musst provided over TP_R.
 The following example is a test circuit with a start signal via ENI / ENO
realized functionality. Figure 2 shows a corresponding trace recording of
the circuit:
name: CLK_DIV

input.name: clk
input.description: The clock input signal used to increment the counter.

input.name: rst
input.description: The reset input signal that initializes the counter and output states.

output.name: Q0
output.description: The first output bit representing the least significant bit of the counter.

output.name: Q1
output.description: The second output bit of the counter.

output.name: Q2
output.description: The third output bit of the counter.

output.name: Q3
output.description: The fourth output bit of the counter.

output.name: Q4
output.description: The fifth output bit of the counter.

output.name: Q5
output.description: The sixth output bit of the counter.

output.name: Q6
output.description: The seventh output bit of the counter.

output.name: Q7
output.description: The eighth output bit representing the most significant bit of the counter.
